caption:
This photograph captures a dramatic industrial scene set against a rugged mountain backdrop under a dusky or possibly stormy sky. In the foreground, a large crane dominates the right half of the image, its silhouette outlined by a bright backlight, possibly from the sun or another intense light source. The crane is of significant size and is equipped with truss structures, indicative of heavy-duty operations, often seen in mining or large-scale construction sites.

The crane is actively engaged, as evidenced by the visible cable lines extending from its boom. Attached to these lines on the far right is a large bucket or container, apparently being moved or lowered. The halo of light and dust around the crane adds a dynamic and somewhat ethereal quality to the scene.

The rough terrain in the foreground is strewn with rocks and debris, typical of a mining or construction site. The background shows jagged mountain peaks, contributing to the sense of a harsh, remote environment. These mountains, partly shrouded in mist or low clouds, enhance the moody and possibly foreboding ambiance of the setting.

Overall, the composition juxtaposes the imposing man-made structure of the crane against the natural ruggedness of the mountainous landscape, highlighted by the dramatic lighting conditions and the activities suggestive of industrial efforts in challenging geographic conditions.
title: Strip mining on Indian burial grounds by Peabody Coal Co.
placename: Black Mesa (Navajo County and Apache County, Ariz.)
